title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.20 | 11-02-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: So, Kunti Devi is actually a pure devotee of the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Queen Kunti's prayer and explains that she is a pure devotee who recognizes Krishna as the Supreme Personality of Godhead.

segments.key_quote: Krishna descends to propagate the transcendental signs of devotional service.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that even intelligent people who can discriminate between matter and spirit may not understand Krishna without devotional service, which is propagated by Krishna and his pure devotees.

segments.key_quote: even for the greatest philosopher Krishna remains the supreme unknown
segments.summary: The speaker discusses how even great philosophical speculators cannot access the Lord and that Krishna is beyond the thinking power of even the greatest philosophers.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is knowable only by one who has got Krishna's mercy
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna is knowable only through his mercy and that women, in general, have an advantage because they readily believe in the Lord's superiority and offer obeisances without reservation.

segments.key_quote: If somebody bows down to Krishna without reservation, yes, my dear Lord, you are the Almighty.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of bowing down to Krishna with sincerity and notes that women often participate more in religious functions, highlighting the effectiveness of simple acceptance over showy religious fervor.

segments.key_quote: Krishna reveals himself to such sincere souls without any discrimination.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna sees the soul within the body and that sincere souls, especially women who readily bow down, can easily receive Krishna's mercy and understand him.
